content: the neckband approx 18 20 22 24 26 cm but it depends on the yarn/gauge you use 3 body the body is worked back and forth and finished with a ribbed hem divide the stitches for body and sleeves while casting on new stitches at the underarms remove the raglan markers at the same time work as follows row 1 rs knit to the marker drop marker knit one front left sts are 33 35 37 41 46 place stitches beginning with the remaining stitch from the raglan on a yarn holder from the left needle drop next marker and finish with one stitch from the raglan sts left sleeve sts are 44 48 50 58 66 cast on 10 10 14 14 14 sts for the underarm using the backward loop method knit the remaining 1 stitch from the raglan drop the marker and knit to the next marker drop marker and knit 1 repeat at the other arm then turn there are 150 158 166 182 202 sts row 2 rs purl work in stockinette stitch until the desired length the next row is a rs row change to a 3 5 us4 circular needle make the rib as wide as you wish with alternating knit and purl stitches as follows slip first stitch *k2 p2* p1 bind off by using your favourite method or see video on hunglish knitter youtube channel sleeves the sleeves are worked in the round on 5 mm us8 circular needle using the magic loop technique place stitches back on the needle pick up 10 10 14 14 14 sts along the sts that were cast on at the underarm on the body there are 54 58 64 72 80 sts on the needle join in the round and work in stockinette stitch 20 20 25 25 25 row place 2 markers under the arm in the centre there are 6 stitches between markers work decreases as follows knit to 2 stitches before the marker knit 2 sts together knitwise mark that stitch to count slip marker knit to marker slip marker knit the next 2 sts together repeat decreases 5 7 8 8 8 times after every 10 10 7 7 7 row there are 44 44 48 56 64 sts on the needle knit to the desired length only in l and xl sizes before you knit the cuff in l decrease 8 sts and in xl decrease 16 sts evenly change to size 3 5 mm needle and finish the sleeves with alternating *k2 p2* stitches 4 front band use 3 5 mm needle from the edges pick up 2 stitches then pick the 3rd stitch from sticking through two legs of the next stitch continue and make sure the numbers are divisible with 4 row 1 rs picking up sts row 2 ws slip 1 *k2 p2* p1 row 3 rs slip 1 *k2 p2* p1 row 4 ws slip 1 *k2 p2* p1 place markers for the buttons
